thread.section_title: Business & Finance News - Wall Street Journal
thread.title: Oil Holds Near Two-Year High, Eyes on Iran

author: Sarah McFarlane
title: Oil Holds Near Two-Year High, Eyes on Iran
text:
Oil prices edged off a 2Â½-year high on Tuesday, after supply disruptions eased in the North Sea and Libya, while rising tensions in major oil exporter Iran underpinned the market.
Light, sweet crude for February delivery fell 22 cents, or 0.4%, to $60.20 a barrel on the New York Mercantile Exchange, after rising briefly earlier in the trading session. Brent, the global oil benchmark, lost 46 cents, or 0.7%, to $66.41 a barrel.
